title: Are they going to add more uses to ward debris?
body:
cause right now they're pretty useless. The idea of "learning  your enemies warding habits" is a cool though, but, is completely useless for 2 reasons:
1. most people have the same warding habits
2. most games dont last very long so you sont have enough time to truly "learn" anything unless you play the same person/people again

replies.body: Lee Sin can now ward hop to both allied and enemy ward debris.

> [{quoted}](name=Rebonack,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=b8Yt4RBF,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-01-28T22:14:59.519+0000)
>
> Lee Sin can now ward hop to both allied and enemy ward debris.

LOL

If you're playing against people that only ward in the usual spots, or you've got a great understanding of the vision game as a whole then yeah, ward debris isn't going to be as meaningful for you. If you're a newer player trying to figure out how to use pinks/red trinkets well though, or you're trying to get a read on something pretty specific (e.g. whether the enemy team's been warding across baron/dragon wall at all) then that's the sort of case ward debris is intended to serve. It's a deliberately small, simple feature, not something that's designed to occupy a lot of mind share.

It's good for non-support mains to learn how to ward.

At least they're subtle enough for any "experienced" warders to not really notice them.
